Three friends standing together and chatting at a street corner in the city.
A woman smiling, sitting at a table, and looking at Home Church notes, while two other friends who are also with her at the table talk and ask questions.
A large group of people hanging out together in an open concept living room for Home Church.

content.text1: In partnership with the Be In Christ denomination of Canada, we're excited to be piloting the concept of The Meeting House Extended Family churches as part of our vision to grow loving communities of Jesus followers beyond our current regional sites. Extended Family Meeting House churches are locally-operated Meeting House expressions that share the Jesus-centered theology, core values, vision, and ministry approach of The Meeting House family of churches.
These are the folks that help make community, discipleship, and Sunday mornings happen.
We work together to create a safe community where our kids and youth can learn to love and follow Jesus. We do this through building relationships, and equipping parents.

image1.alt: A young child playing with blocks.
Several groups of people chatting in a living room.
Three people talking over an open bible at Home Church.
Three men sitting on a couch and talking.

content.text1: Something really good happens when we gather in our neighbourhoods to share life, grow deeper spiritual friendships, and talk about how we can live Jesus-centred lives, all while we invite others to join us.
We want to use our money, time, and resources to love and serve people on the margins.

image1.alt: Friends hanging out together and playing music at a campfire.
A young woman is talking to her friends in the church lobby.

content.text2: No need to take big leaps. Drop your email below and we'll send you some of our favourite content and suggest some small next steps you can take.
